statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Given a positive integer N, you should output the leftmost digit of N^N.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The input contains several test cases. The first line of the input is a single integer T which is the number of test cases. T test cases follow.
Each test case contains a single positive integer N(1<=N<=1,000,000,000).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, you should output the leftmost digit of N^N.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
2
2


Hint

In the first case, 3 * 3 * 3 = 27, so the leftmost digit is 2.
In the second case, 4 * 4 * 4 * 4 = 256, so the leftmost digit is 2.
